column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I think it's disgusting to have to pay hundreds of dollars for a bottle of meds that stains the toilets so terribly and has so many side effects. column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had life long problems with urinary pain (chronic sever infections & stricture abstruction), this is by far the best medication out there. It is much better than Pyridium. You have to suggest it because alot of doctor's are not too familiar with it.

column2: Lisa MO, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Urelle causes severe nausea for me as well as being ineffective.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: great!

column2: Donna, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: When I get bladder spasms occasionally, I take only 1 Urelle tablet and it goes away.  After gall bladder surgery, I get intestinal spasms occasionally.  Urelle is like a miracle drug.  I take only 1 pill and the spasms and heartburn stop.  My gastroenterologist told me he has heard other patients who get the same relief and has been prescribing it for GI spasms.  I cannot live without this drug.  Who cares about the blue color as long as the drug works.

column2: Paula, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication is horrible. Four days after I was taking the medication, I started with rectal bleeding. In March I was diagnosed with Ulcerative Colitis. I believe that this medicine caused this problem because I was fine before that.

column2: K, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Prescribed to me for the development of IC as a result of endometriosis. It's been extremely effective and has never caused the nausea and vomiting that I experienced with prescription doses of pyridium. With respects to worrying about the blue staining, in my opinion, it's well worth the small risk in order to be pain-free. The medication is also very effective with pain associated to spasms during menstruation, particularly as drugs don't only work for specific areas of the body. The single thing that could be a problem with Urelle is cost - even covered by insurance, it can get quite expensive.

column2: none, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: For some reason one year after prostatectomy, I started with some very painful urination and constant use of the bathroom.  I eventually ended up pretty dehydrated.  After a cyctoscope by my doctor to make sure nothing was wrong, he gave me Urelle on the directions of once a day.  In 30 minutes it took the pain away and allowed me to significantlly re-hydrate.  I have been taking it for three days now and once a day and it is working great.  Perhaps I am a bit tired but I was before I started taking the drug.  Pryidium was not effective.

column2: dannicred, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this medicine after a kidney stone was discovered and a stent was put into my kidney/bladder to keep the kidney stone in place and the kidney draining properly until I can have surgery to remove it.  It relieves the pain while urinating and also the sudden urge to urinate.

column2: PZ, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: reelchip, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Surprised how expensive and not FDA approved.  Took for 5 days appeared to help at first then didn't.  Took 4 times/day and urine was blue/green.  On 6th day urine was yellow and took morning & noon then stopped - urine remained yellow until the following night then became blue/green and was still green for 2 1/2 days after stopping.  Concerned about how long it remains in system I tried to look up info in the usual drug sites and could not find it listed so I contacted the FDA and was informed it was not FDA approved so there are no clinical trials and they did not have any info but was able to locate info on this site.

column2: spink101, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was suffering from bladder spasms, and was in extreme pain my urologist prescribed this for the spasms, side effects are low, expect urine color change. column2: Maryqc1@verizon.net, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have become VERY nervous and had becomevery high-strung and over-reactive to themost ordinary things.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have Interstitial Cystitis. This is the only thing that I can take to ease the pain of urination whenever my IC flares. I recommend it heartily.

column2: bco09aggiemom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a kidney stone removed and a stent placed.  The doctor prescribed Urelle for the bladder spasms caused by the stent.  While Urelle has done an excellent job of relieving the spasms, I experienced a few of the side effects.  Some of them were blue urine, irritation of the stomach, frequent urination, drowsiness, low energy, felt like throwing up, and weakness.  These were a satisfactory trade-off to be free of the bladder spasms.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was suffering acutely from a UTI.  I waited until I thought I couldn't take it any more to seek treatment.  My blood pressure was high due to the pain.  Within a half hour of taking the medication I felt so much more relaxed.  My blood pressure lowered.  Within a day, the urgency to urinate constantly subsided.  It turns urine a bluish green color which was actually comforting to me as I felt like I didn't have blockage, just an infection.
